currentDoc:
How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the da

For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world. How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world. It turns match making and meeting people i

For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world. How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a nu

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer m

This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more ge

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meeti

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with larg

I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having mul

This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people

This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a co

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a con

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in the

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match q

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match qeu

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. Du

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the pandem

This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing p

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pa

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps an

Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it pos

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to contin

This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. Peo

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally an

I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not be

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Ap

This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and s

This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to kee

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions a

For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just tha

During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it lets people wo

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it lets people wou

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it lets people who may normally not

This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it lets people who may normall

Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it lets p

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it lets

I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to p

This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wo

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. J

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their soc

Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their social circles don't ru

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their social circles don't run parrallel

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their social circles don't run with one another.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their social circles don't run with one another.

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their social circles don't run with one another. 

So there

This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their social circles don't run with one another. 

So like all

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their social circles don't run with one another. 

So like all technology, there ar

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their social circles don't run with one another. 

So like all technology, there are pros to cons to both

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their social circles don't run with one another. 

So like all technology, there are pros to cons to both. It all falls on peop

Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their social circles don't run with one another. 

So like all technology, there are pros to cons to both. It all falls on people to use them for go

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their social circles don't run with one another. 

So like all technology, there are pros to cons to both. It all falls on people to use them for goo

This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their social circles don't run with one another. 

So like all technology, there are pros to cons to both. It all falls on people to use them for good over nefariou

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their social circles don't run with one another. 

So like all technology, there are pros to cons to both. It all falls on people to use them for good over nefarious purposes.  Unforu

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their social circles don't run with one another. 

So like all technology, there are pros to cons to both. It all falls on people to use them for good over nefarious purposes.  Unforunately, people wil

I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps. This can be a problem for people who are not as attractive or have pictures that aren't as flattering.  This can cause them to feel even more rejected than they normally would in the dating world.

Another thing it does is turn dating and match making into a numbers game. Instead of fewer, more genuine meetings, people are matching with large numbers of people and having multiple conversations at the same time. This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their social circles don't run with one another. 

So like all technology, there are pros to cons to both. It all falls on people to use them for good over nefarious purposes.  Unforunately, people w

This can cause people to be more shallow and less genuine in their interactions. Or it can lead to people being less invested into  a conversation because they have more prospects lined up in their match queue to interact with. 

With that said, I do believe that technology can be a positive thing for dating. During the recent and ongoing pandemic apps and social media made it possible for people to continue to connect online. People suffered mentally and emotionally from not being able to socialize. Dating apps and such gave them a way to keep their interactions alive. It gave them a way to connect with people who were going through the same struggles. Not just that but it gives a chance to people who normally wouldn't meet. Just because their social circles don't run with one another. 

So like all technology, there are pros to cons to both. It all falls on people to use them for good over nefarious purposes.  Unforunately, people will a

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

In my opinion,  technology can be a double edged sword when it comes to dating. It can reinforce certain things in dating that can be seen as a negative. For example, dating apps mainly use pictures to get the attention of people using them. Yes you can write a short biography but putting what you think will attract someone isn't always honest. So what else is there to judge someone by? Their pictures. I believe that more often than not, people with more pictures and high attractiveness tends to get more responses and attention on those apps.
